    Subclass Controller. This class is created one for each controller.
    Author:
    hroesdiyono

    • Method Detail

      • initializeController

        public ReturnCode initializeController(int controllerBaudrate,
                              byte receiveFilterType)
        Open a connection to the controller, determine the baudrate manually, initialize the receive filter, and read the status of the Controller. It is also reset the setting of the controller to its default setting. The receive filter type should only be determined once, and should not be changed after the controller is running or any MessageChannel object is created. This method can only be used once in order to make sure that the receive filter is not changed. This method also fill the controllerStatus of API_ADK.intDeviceList automatically.
        Parameters:
        controllerBaudrate - Input: The value of baudrate (10 - 1000).
        receiveFilterType - Input: The value of frame format (ConstantList.HARDWARE_FILTER, or ConstantList.SOFTWARE_FILTER).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BAUDRATE_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BUS_COUPLING, ReturnCode.BAUDRATE_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.FAIL_INITIALIZING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.BUS_COUPLING_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_FILTER_TYPE, ReturnCode.FAIL_USING_SETTINGS_DEFAULT, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • initializeController

        public ReturnCode initializeController(byte receiveFilterType)
        Open a connection to the controller, determine the baudrate automatically (the CAN bus should be active), and initialize the receive filter. The receive filter type should only be determined once, and should not be changed after the controller is running or any MessageChannel object is created.
        Parameters:
        receiveFilterType - Input: The value of frame format (ConstantList.HARDWARE_FILTER, or ConstantList.SOFTWARE_FILTER).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.INVALID_BUS_COUPLING, ReturnCode.INVALID_TIMEOUT_VALUE, ReturnCode.NO_BAUDRATE_DETECTED, ReturnCode.BUS_COUPLING_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_FILTER_TYPE, ReturnCode.FAIL_USING_SETTINGS_DEFAULT, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • deinitializeController

        public ReturnCode deinitializeController()
        Disconnect from a controller and deinitialize the Controller object. This method will only return success if all MessageChannels that use this controller have been closed. After calling this method, the class object becomes unusable, any other methods will not be executed.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS or ReturnCode.MESSAGE_CHANNEL_STILL_USING_CONTROLLER.

      • readControllerStatus

        public ReturnCode readControllerStatus(CANInfo controllerStatus)
        Read the status of the CAN controller. Use API_ADK.Device.readErrorStatus(API.ADK.ErrorBuffer) instead.
        Parameters:
        controllerStatus - Output: The status of the CAN controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.CANINFO_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • enableControllerListenMode

        public ReturnCode enableControllerListenMode(byte mode)
        Enable or disable the listen mode of the CAN controller. This listen mode determines the format of the received message. Binary format is shorter than the ASCII format, so it takes less time and increase data rate. The Off mode means that the device will not relay any message. If the mode is Off, calling startController() would change the mode to ASCII. To change the mode to Off, start the controller first before calling this method.
        Note that Sending any message (in ASCII or Binary format) will change the mode to the respective message format, for example Off to Binary, or Binary to ASCII.
        Parameters:
        mode - Input: The value of mode (ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_OFF, ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_ASCII, or ConstantList.SEND_FRAME_BINARY).
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.COMMAND_NOT_SUPPORTED, ReturnCode.INVALID_INPUT_MODE, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • startController

        public ReturnCode startController()
        Start the CAN Controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.FAIL_STARTING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • stopController

        public ReturnCode stopController()
        Stop the CAN Controller.
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.FAIL_SEARCHING_STRING, ReturnCode.INVALID_RESPONSE, ReturnCode.FAIL_STOPPING_CONTROLLER, ReturnCode.WAITING_FOR_RESPONSE_TIMEOUT, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD, or ReturnCode.NO_RESPONSE.

      • transmitMessage

        public ReturnCode transmitMessage(MessageStructure message,
                         byte messageFormat)
        Put a message to the transmit buffer. The internal transmit thread will send the message to the device or collective message every 5ms. This method is optimized for fast and repetitive sending message for more than 1 message in the interval of 5ms.
        There are 2 message formats, ASCII and binary. Binary format is shorter than the ASCII format, so it takes less time and increase data rate.
        Note that Sending any message (in ASCII or Binary format) will change the receive message mode to the respective message format, for example Off to Binary, or Binary to ASCII. The method returns success if it could successfully put the message into the transmit buffer. Call API_ADK.Device.readErrorStatus(API.ADK.ErrorBuffer) to check whether the Device could send the message to the CAN bus or the internal transmit thread is still working.
        Parameters:
        message - Input: Message to be sent.
        messageFormat - Input: (ConstantList.ASCII_FORMAT, or ConstantList.BINARY_FORMAT)
        Returns:
        ReturnCode.SUCCESS, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_DEINITIALIZED, ReturnCode.OBJECT_IS_NOT_INITIALIZED, ReturnCode.STRING_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.FAIL_CONVERTING_TO_ARRAY, ReturnCode.FAIL_WRITING_TO_BLUETOOTH, ReturnCode.MESSAGESTRUCTURE_OBJECT_NOT_VALID, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_FORMAT, ReturnCode.INVALID_MESSAGE_ID_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_FORMAT_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_LENGTH, ReturnCode.INVALID_DATA_VALUE, ReturnCode.INVALID_FRAME_TYPE_VALUE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_ACQUIRE, ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SEMAPHORE_RELEASE, ReturnCode.WAITING_TO_SEND_TIMEOUT, or ReturnCode.EXCEPTION_SLEEP_THREAD.
